item.title: Zelda Switch 2 Games And Amiibo Are Up For Preorder
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/legend-of-zelda-nintendo-switch-2-tears-of-the-kingdom-breath-of-the-wild-amiibo-preorder/1100-6530751/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

The Nintendo Switch 2 versions of The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild and Tears of the Kingdom are available to preorder now. These upgraded editions of two of the best Switch games will be available when the Switch 2 launches on June 5. Existing owners can purchase an upgrade from the eShop for $10 each to gain access to the Switch 2 versions, but physical copies with new Switch 2 packaging are available as well. Tears of the Kingdom and Breath of the Wild are launching alongside four new Amiibo figures based on the Champions from Tears of the Kingdom: Tulin, Yunobo, Sidon, and Riju.

Breath of the Wild and Tears of the Kingdom are among a handful of select Nintendo Switch games getting upgraded versions with new content on Nintendo Switch 2. Like other Switch 2 Edition games, Breath of the Wild and Tears of the Kingdom Switch 2 Editions will offer better visuals and performance than their Switch 1 versions, and will include additional features like support for the all-new Zelda Notes app, which offers daily login item bonuses, a helpful map that shows your in-game location in real time, the ability to share stats with other players online, and more.

Breath of the Wild and Tears of the Kingdom each have a much larger emphasis on inventory management than the older Zelda games, and the controls can be somewhat cumbersome at times. These are games that greatly benefit from controllers with remappable back buttons. Thankfully, the official Switch 2 Pro Controller has a pair of built-in back buttons. If you're interested in the Switch 2 versions of these Zelda games, you may want to snag a preorder for the Switch 2 Pro Controller, too. The Switch 2 Pro Controller releases alongside the games and console on June 5.

The Legend of Zelda New Amiibo Figures

The new batch of Zelda Amiibo feature expressive poses from fan-favorites from Tears of the Kingdom. The new set includes the first four Champions Link partners up with during his quest to save Hyrule: Tulin, Yunobo, Sidon, and Riju. All four are available to preorder for $30 each, which is nearly twice the price Nintendo charged for several previous Tears of the Kingdom Amiibo figures.

Zelda Official Strategy Guides

It's also worth noting that the official guidebooks for Tears of the Kingdom and Breath of the Wild are still available to purchase, and you can save big on hardcover editions at Amazon.

What are Switch 2 Edition games?

Nintendo Switch 2 Edition games are upgraded versions of Switch 1 games featuring enhancements exclusively for Switch 2. Along with The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild and Tears of the Kingdom, several other Switch 2 Editions were announced at the April 2 Switch 2 Direct showcase, including versions for existing games like Super Mario Party Jamboree and Kirby and the Forgotten Land that include visual enhancements and all-new, exclusive content, as well as upcoming Switch 1 games like Metroid Prime 4: Beyond and Pokemon Legends Z-A.

All Switch 2 Editions Games

Preorders available now:

  • The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild Switch 2 Edition -- $70 | Releases June 5
  • The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom Switch 2 Edition -- $80 | Releases June 5
  • Super Mario Party Jamboree + Jamboree TV -- $80 | Releases July 24
  • Kirby and the Forgotten Land + Star-Crossed World -- $80 | Releases August 28

Coming soon:

  • Metroid Prime 4: Beyond -- Price TBA | Releases 2025
  • Pokemon Legends: Z-A -- Price TBA | Releases Late 2025

All of these games will be available as standalone physical and digital versions or digital upgrades for those who own the Switch 1 versions. Note that Switch 2 Edition games are separate from simply playing Switch 1 Edition games on the new Switch 2 console via backward compatibility, which you'll be able to do for free.

The Switch 2 will also have plenty of all-new exclusives, including the system's big launch title, Mario Kart World, as well as a decent list of other new games to look forward to after the system releases, such as Donkey Kong Bananza on July 17--not to mention a long list of third-party games like Bravely Default: Flying Fairy HD, Street Fighter 6, and more. You can see a full list of all the confirmed Nintendo Switch 2 games below. As for where you can preorder the console and its various accessories, you'll find all the info in our Nintendo Switch 2 preorder guide.

Nintendo Switch 2 Games at Walmart

Switch 2 Exclusives:

  • Mario Kart World -- $80 (June 5)
  • The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild Switch 2 Edition -- $70 (June 5)
  • The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom Switch 2 Edition -- $80 (June 5)
  • Bravely Default Flying Fairy HD Remaster -- $40 (June 5)
  • Donkey Kong Bananza -- $70 (July 17)
  • Super Mario Party Jamboree + Jamboree TV Switch 2 Edition -- $80 (July 24)
  • Kirby and the Forgotten Land + Star-Crossed World Switch 2 Edition -- $80 (August 28)

More Switch 2 Games:

  • Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma -- $70 (June 5)
  • Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma - Earth Dancer Edition -- $110 (with Switch 2 upgrade)
  • Street Fighter 6: Years 1-2 Fighters Edition -- $60 (June 5)
  • No Sleep For Kaname Date - From AI: The Somnium Files -- $50 (July 25)
  • Story of Seasons: Grand Bazaar -- $60 (August 27)
  • Story of Seasons: Grand Bazaar Premium Edition -- $80 (August 27)
  • Daemon X Machina: Titanic Scion -- $70 (September 5)
  • Daemon X Machina: Titanic Scion Limited Edition -- $100 (September 5)

More Nintendo Switch 2 Official Accessory Preorders

  • Nintendo Switch 2 Pro Controller -- $85
  • Samsung 256GB microSD Express Card -- $60
  • Switch 2 Camera -- $55
  • Joy-Con 2 Controllers (2-Pack) -- $95
  • Carrying Case & Screen Protector -- $40
  • All-In-One Carrying Case -- $85
  • AC Adapter -- $35
  • Joy-Con 2 (Right, Red Strap) -- $55
  • Joy-Con 2 (Left, Blue Strap) -- $55
  • Joy-Con 2 Charging Grip -- $40
  • Joy-Con 2 Straps (2-Pack) -- $14
  • Joy-Con 2 Racing Wheels (2-Pack) -- $25

item.title: Mario Kart World Switch 2 Game & Accessory Preorders Are Live
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/mario-kart-world-switch-2-game-accessory-preorders-are-live/1100-6530753/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Mario Kart World launches exclusively for Nintendo Switch 2 on June 5, the same day as the new console. Nintendo's new open-world racing game is easily the console's biggest launch title, and preorders are now live alongside the Switch 2 with multiple options are available. Fans can preorder Mario Kart World on its own for $80, or grab a $500 bundle that includes the Switch 2 and a download code for the game.

Quick look: Mario Kart World & related Switch 2 products

  • Mario Kart World -- $79 (June 5)
  • Nintendo Switch 2 Mario Kart World Console Bundle -- $500
  • Joy-Con 2 Racing Wheels (2-Pack) -- $25
  • Joy-Con 2 Controllers (2-Pack) -- $94
  • Joy-Con 2 (Right, Red Strap) -- $54
  • Joy-Con 2 (Left, Blue Strap) -- $54
  • Nintendo Switch 2 Pro Controller -- $84

For a comprehensive look at all the Switch 2 games and accessories available, as well as a list of where you can find the console itself, be sure to check our Switch 2 preorder guide.

Mario Kart World

$80 | Releases June 5

Like other Switch 2 launch games, Mario Kart World is getting a standard edition that will run you $80. That pricing applies to physical and digital versions alike. That's a big step up from the $60 average for Nintendo Switch games and $70 average for PS5 and Xbox Series X games. There are no extras or special features included in this version--it's just the base game. However, you'll get a physical copy to add to your shelf, and the full game is on the cartridge. You can preorder physical copies of Mario Kart World standard edition at Walmart, Target, GameStop, and Best Buy.

Joy-Con 2 Wheel Set

$25 | Releases June 5

You can use standard stick and button inputs to race, but Mario Kart World will also support motion controls, allowing players to tilt their controllers like a real steering wheel for increased immersion. If you plan on using the tilt controls, check out Nintendo's official Joy-Con 2 Wheel Set.

These controller attachments actually look quite nice for the price, with textured covers reminiscent of actual steering wheels. It's also cool that each two-pack comes with one red and one blue wheel to match the color accents on the left and right Joy-Con 2 Controllers.

GameStop is releasing its own Joy-Con 2 Wheels. Two-packs of red and black wheels cost $17. It's hard to say for sure without testing both of them, but GameStop's attachments certainly look cheaper.

Alternatively, you can race with the Switch 2 Pro Controller and remap inputs, such as drifting, to the pair of back buttons Nintendo added to its new traditional controller.

Mario Kart World looks to be a gorgeous, expansive new entry in the long-running arcade racing series, offering a fully explorable world map for the first time. Players will be able to explore on- and off-road alongside other players, take on unique mission challenges scattered around the world, or engage in traditional racing and battle modes across numerous all-new tracks. The game will also have a staggering roster of up to 84 playable characters, with up to 24 competing at a time in the various racing modes. This is the Switch 2's marquee launch title, and if you're interested in learning more, be sure to check our latest Mario Kart World hands-on impressions.

More Nintendo Switch 2 Games

While Mario Kart is the biggest Switch 2 launch title, it's not the only game releasing for the new console on June 5. You can also pick up the Switch 2 Editions of The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild and Tears of the Kingdom, which will feature enhanced visuals and integration with a new smartphone app that lets you check the map and other new features right from your phone. Other Switch 2 games launching on June 5 include a port of Capcom's popular fighting game Street Fighter 6. These new Switch 2 Editions of Zelda and Street Fighter 6 are also getting new sets of Amiibo that are available to preorder as well. There are even more Switch 2 games available to preorder, and you'll find a list of them all below.

Switch 2 Exclusives:

  • Mario Kart World -- $80 (June 5)
  • The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild Switch 2 Edition -- $70 (June 5)
  • The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom Switch 2 Edition -- $80 (June 5)
  • Bravely Default Flying Fairy HD Remaster -- $40 (June 5)
  • Donkey Kong Bananza -- $70 (July 17)
  • Super Mario Party Jamboree + Jamboree TV Switch 2 Edition -- $80 (July 24)
  • Kirby and the Forgotten Land + Star-Crossed World Switch 2 Edition -- $80 (August 28)

More Switch 2 Games:

  • Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma -- $70 (June 5)
  • Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma - Earth Dancer Edition -- $110 (with Switch 2 upgrade)
  • Street Fighter 6: Years 1-2 Fighters Edition -- $60 (June 5)
  • No Sleep For Kaname Date - From AI: The Somnium Files -- $50 (July 25)
  • Story of Seasons: Grand Bazaar -- $60 (August 27)
  • Story of Seasons: Grand Bazaar Premium Edition -- $80 (August 27)
  • Daemon X Machina: Titanic Scion -- $70 (September 5)
  • Daemon X Machina: Titanic Scion Limited Edition -- $100 (September 5)

Nintendo Switch 2 Accessories

Another notable accessory you might want to consider is Samsung's officially licensed 256GB microSD Express Card, which will double the storage space on your Switch 2.

  • Nintendo Switch 2 Pro Controller -- $84
  • Joy-Con 2 Controllers (2-Pack) -- $94
  • Samsung 256GB microSD Express Card -- $60
  • Switch 2 Camera -- $54
  • Carrying Case & Screen Protector -- $40
  • All-In-One Carrying Case -- $84
  • AC Adapter -- $35
  • Joy-Con 2 (Right, Red Strap) -- $54
  • Joy-Con 2 (Left, Blue Strap) -- $54
  • Joy-Con 2 Charging Grip -- $40
  • Joy-Con 2 Straps (2-Pack) -- $14
  • Joy-Con 2 Racing Wheels (2-Pack) -- $25

Nintendo Switch 2 Amiibo

  • The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom Amiibo | Release June 5
    • Tulin -- $30
    • Yunobo -- $30
    • Sidon -- $30
    • Riju -- $30
  • Street Fighter 6 Amiibo | Release Jun 5
    • Jamie -- $40
    • Luke -- $40
    • Kimberly -- $40

item.title: MLB The Show 25 Gets First Big Discount For PS5, Xbox, And Switch
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/mlb-the-show-25-gets-first-big-discount-for-ps5-xbox-and-switch/1100-6531048/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

MLB The Show 25 is on sale for a big discount at Amazon just one month after launch. Sports fans can save $20 on Sony San Diego Studio's annual baseball sim for PS5, Xbox Series X, and Nintendo Switch. The PlayStation and Xbox editions are up for grabs for $50 (was $70), while the Switch version is down to $40 (was $60). Since it just released on March 18, this is unsurprisingly the best deal so far on MLB The Show 25.

MLB The Show 25 Deals at Amazon:

  • PS5 -- $50 ($70)
  • Xbox Series X -- $50 ($70)
  • Nintendo Switch -- $40 ($60)

MLB The Show 25

PS5: $50 | Xbox: $50 | Switch: $40

Our MLB The Show 25 review gave it an impressive 8/10, praising it for improving the Road to the Show mode, creating an engaging free agency system, and making a few tweaks to gameplay that make fielding more enjoyable. Note that the Switch version does not support custom stadiums, and its graphics arent quite as impressive. But beyond that, theyre essentially the same game. Regardless of which platform youre playing on, this current deal makes it a mighty enticing offer.

The latest MLB season began on March 18, when the Los Angeles Dodgers and Chicago Cubs played in the Tokyo Series--though most other teams just started a few weeks ago on March 27. So if your team is already falling behind the count (or you need something to bide time between games), MLB The Show 25 is an easy recommendation.

If youre looking for some cool MLB merch, last years MLB The Show 24: Negro Leagues Edition is available for $34.50 on Xbox Series X. It comes with a copy of MLB The Show 24 as well as a display-worthy steelbook case and New Era baseball cap.

item.title: Ghost of Yotei Collector's Edition Revealed, Preorders Start May 2
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/ghost-of-yotei-collectors-edition-revealed-preorders-start-may-2/1100-6531054/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

PlayStation has revealed that Ghost of Yotei will launch on October 2 with three different editions for PS5. Preorders for Ghost of Yotei's pair of physical editions, including a Collector's Edition that's exclusive to PlayStation Direct, will begin on May 2 at 10 AM ET. All preorders include several pieces of DLC.

If you want to play the original before Ghost of Yotei's release, you can pick up Ghost of Tsushima's Director's Cut for $49.49 (was $70) right now. Ghost of Yotei takes place 300-plus years after Ghost of Tsushima, so you don't technically need to play Sucker Punch Productions' first entry in the action series. That said, playing it would give you a pretty good idea of what to expect from Yotei. Though the cast of characters is entirely new, the premise and themes will sound familiar. You'll once again embark on a revenge mission as "The Ghost."

Ghost of Yotei Preorder Bonuses

Preorder any edition of Ghost of Yotei to unlock an exclusive in-game mask, plus seven PSN avatars. These feature concept art of characters from the game--including the main character Atsu and the notorious Yotei Six. Its unclear if there will be any retailer-exclusive preorder bonuses.

Ghost of Yotei Digital Deluxe Edition

$80

The Digital Deluxe Edition is available at the PlayStation Store, and it gets you a few extra in-game goodies along with the base game. This includes:

  • The Snake armor
  • Unique armor dye
  • Unique charm
  • Unique horse and saddle
  • Travelers Maps (Early unlock)
  • Sword Kit

Youll also get any eligible preorder bonuses, making this a great way to stock up on in-game gear.

Ghost of Yotei Collectors Edition

$250

The $250 Ghost of Yotei Collectors Edition is packed with physical goodies. Along with the Digital Deluxe Edition of the game, heres what else is included:

  • Replica Atsu Ghost Mask (6.8 x 5 x 5.9 inches)
  • Replica Atsus Sash (71 inches)
  • Replica Tsuba from Atsus katana
  • Pouch of coins
  • Instructions for Zeni Hajiki game
  • Foldable papercraft ginkgo tree
  • Art cards

The Collectors Edition will be available to preorder at PlayStation Direct. Its bound to be popular, so be sure to set your alarm for 10 AM ET on May 2.
